title: Am I the only one who does not want Lee Sin to be buffed?
body:
Just because his Win ratio dropped doesnt mean he's in bad spot. 
He's where he's supposed to be, a champ that's highly picked and requires more time to master than your average champion does not need any buffs just because a jungle item was removed or because he dropped to 48% win ratio.

I've recently started play Lee again, and I'm quite enjoying that he's not picked much around my Elo.

Why instead of buffing him you just nerf whatever is broken both in the jungle and toplane?
{{champion:14}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:19}}  and many others, need some toning down.
Stop buffing champions to balance the equation.

replies.body: The fact that his winrate plummeted after the removal of tracker’s knife is evidence of an underlying issue. He’s much too reliant on his ability to ward hop and I think it’s time to revisit that mechanic. Riot should take this time to seriously consider giving him a mini rework and removing his ward hopping mechanic just like they’ve done to other champs.
I guess the players still go in situation where they think they can just ward hop out. When you give them more time the winrate will go up again.

> [{quoted}](name=Hügö,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dl8Xsai5,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2018-03-03T15:56:06.547+0000)
>
> I guess the players still go in situation where they think they can just ward hop out. When you give them more time the winrate will go up again.

Exactly. Before Tracker's was actually a thing, Lee was still a top tier jungler (that cycled in and out, depending on the meta, with Elise). 

So what did Lee Sin do before unlimited wards? Good players thrived and bad players cried. 

This is simply a result of poor players getting a rude awakening to stop being careless and diving into fights that shouldn't be normally survivable and getting to live afterwards. Because they now don't have their safety net to go ham.
Before Tracker's was a thing lee bought Sight Stone which has now been removed from the game. With no Tracker's and no Sight Stone Lee just doesn't have the play making potential he used to have.

Lee has a trinket. It stores 2 charges. If he can't manage to function with 2 free wards that recharge, he deserves to be guttered. The fact that he abuses wards for "play making potential" instead of granting vision on the map should be indicative of some major flaws in his kit design.

> [{quoted}](name=Oleandervine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dl8Xsai5,comment-id=00040000000200000001,timestamp=2018-03-05T15:19:15.112+0000)

It has a 75 second CD....

And every 75 seconds he can do gimmicks with wards. Off of that, he has to be like everyone else and use minions, monsters, and other players to dash. Honestly, ward hopping on Lee is something they should have pulled out of his kit long ago, and turned into something like Katarina's daggers are now.

There are champions thats been sitting in the gutter for years. A few months is nothing to be crying about. Especially when he is viable, he's a nightmare to deal with. So take a seat. 

Also, he can still ward hop. It ain't removed. Learn to read your own statements before you start smashing down keys. They simply returned him back to before when SS/Tracker's was available to be abused. Back before these free wards, he still did great. And he's still going to do just fine (as he's sitting around a ~47% just fresh off the change). It takes a little longer for people to adapt to the changes and I expect it to go up in the next patch cycle once. If it was that serious, it would've tanked to low 40s. If they need to, they can simply put a little power in the rest of his kit to bump him back up a little more.  

This change simply separates the bad from the good players. For a champion with such a high skill cap, it shouldn't be that easy to play with to begin with. Bad players spammed free wards to get out of situations where normally, it shouldn't be survivable. Think about that for a second and then get back to me.

What's stopping him from getting zombie wards and a fuck ton of wards as well if everyone else has access to it? I'll tell you what. Because those that do get them lose out on something in exchange for vision. If you want vision, you give up something. If you want something else, you give up vision. You don't get to be greedy and get both like Lee Sin did with SS/Tracker's. 

Also, {{item:2055}}  to ward hop. As well as {{item:3340}}  if you are that cheap. S2 Lee Sin made the sacrifice to either drop a ward (that costed $$$) to escape/make plays or used it for vision. It's no different now with the removal of Tracker's.
I think lee's ward hop is what makes him unique. Remove it and he becomes another generic assassin.

Relax. I don't like him because he has a point to click (R) Kick CC, that's the only thing I don't like about him. No need to respond in a toxic tone.

Champions with high playrate shouldn't have high win rate, because that means people who have very few games on them are still winning half of their games. Lee Sin is a popular pick and has a high playrate almost always. That's probably why people don't want him buffed despite his lower than average winrate. because streamers exist???

The argument being made is that his WR compared to his playrate is normally somewhat low because there's more potential to either mess up or make big plays on Lee.

However, Lee's issue has always been that while his fancy mechanics are difficult enough the rest of his kit is pretty easy.  Jump to target thing, Q in face, do lots of damage.  His consistency has always been too high for someone who is supposed to be "hard to play."  He dominated the jungle scene for like 3 seasons or more. 

Personally I'm glad not to be seeing Lee Sin like every single game.  I don't hate the champion (my most hated champion is Fizz.. that champion needs a rework), but it's nice to see some shake ups in the meta.

yup he's fair now, people always lash at me when i say this. But the removal of the jg item didn't make lee sin weaker or shit just made him fair. A lot of champions with conditional maneuver shouldn't have it granted to them at will. Lee sin dashing past you and kicking you to his team is a freebie when fairness it should be a conditional maneuver where he should just learn to gank behind the target to do so.

This ^^. Like when Zac's rework came out he had a 37% winrate. That didn't mean he was weak at all. It just meant he was difficult to play. Riot sadly listened to the QQ and buffed him and he became such a huge problem due to how OP he was now. Winrate alone isn't a good stat. With this change, people need time to learn and adapt. Let's revisit it in a few weeks or something >_> Promise the winrate will go back up

Not disagreeing, but just wanted to point out that Zac's WR changed because his entire gank pattern was updated.  He used to be far more burst oriented and incorporate auto attacks into his rotation.  On top of that his old ult was a disruption and anti engage utility vs. the new one which actively grabs people and moves them.  

They first buffed the ult because it took too long and people were walking out of it.  After that, however, he received a series of nerfs including making less bloblets with his Q when he clears.  They also added an indicator on his jump to show you where he is going to land.

Thankfully though, aside from being able to jump into a lane from off screen, Zac is otherwise a pretty fair champion to deal with so long as you are warding farther away.

I do suspect your right and Lee's WR will come back up in a week.
Nah, plenty of people don't want him buffed. Long as peoples' reasoning for it isn't complete garbage I tend to agree with it.

Lee is too well-rounded as a champ and has no identifiable weaknessess.  He has burst, mobilitity, sustain, a slow and a knockback, etc.

I am and have been for multiple seasons a proponent of removing some things from his kit and buffing others.
See I could get behind this. I don't mind them sharpening him up, so long as he isn't weak :(
I have no problem with Lee being strong so long as he has identifiable areas of strength and weakness.

> [{quoted}](name=Crede777,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dl8Xsai5,comment-id=0013,timestamp=2018-03-03T18:01:47.228+0000)
>
> Lee is too well-rounded as a champ and has no identifiable weaknessess.  He has burst, mobilitity, sustain, a slow and a knockback, etc.
> 
> I am and have been for multiple seasons a proponent of removing some things from his kit and buffing others.

Yeah, I would like it if they actually turned Lee into an assassin or a tanky jungler instead of a hybrid.  Assassin probably fits him best given his playstyle (dash in on a target and try to 1 shot them with Q and some combination of his other abilities and R if they don't die immediately).  He needs a clear theme rather than jack of all trades.
Lee Sin is too strong as he is. Buffing him is just retarded.

Oh look, Lee Sin players don't have his retarded escape anymore.

Please, don't buff him, he is finally fine now.

Fair enough... although I'd argue that Warwick is just very forgiving rather than being OP.

Like any other running champion he can be kited and otherwise rendered useless in certain games.  As a champion the point of the rework was to make a playable, but very forgiving champion that any new player could pick up and not bomb with.

He also looks really strong at the lower elo's because he is a strong duelist and not as easily punished.  Things like kiting out and cc'ing targets (see also Nasus, Yi, and Riven) don't become more common until higher up.

People play him a lot because he's fun and at least relatively easy to pick up.  His overall strength though isn't any higher than a lot of other junglers.   Take for example Volibear was at the top of the charts this patch, and while the new buffs did a lot for him he still isn't that strong higher up.  Same thing.

i dont like the lee buffs either,lee will always be the champ of mains and one tricks,a player who knows how to lee can easily one shot the adc and the buffs will make him broken if they want more players apart from the mains and one tricks to play him then they should rework this gameplay

The problem is that his skill cap was decreased exponentially with the removal of more wards. The less wards you have, the less opportunities to make those "sick montage plays" or whatever that make lee a high skill cap champion.

And it's not just about balance. Sure, it's great to have a champion that isn't too weak or too strong, but that doesn't matter when that champion isn't fun at all to play. Lee sin right now just feels so much worse now without trackers. Plays you could've easily made if you were good at him earlier you now can't do because you have to wait another minute on your ward, which pushes him to a more farm heavy playstyle as oppose to invading/ganking. I know a lot of people here on the boards will bitch about ganking junglers all day and just want to turn the role into a second vegetable support in which you just play tanks and farm until you become unkillable.

Also fiora is not a problem, just going to put that out there now.

> The problem is that his skill cap was decreased exponentially with the removal of more wards.

I think what you wanted to say (or should have said) is that it has increased because he now has to chose between spamming wards and keeping them for ward jumping.

Except now you don't need to think about pathing because there is only one option now, which is farming because you can't risk invading because of limited amount of wards and cant really gank without wards.

I'd consider him balanced. His winrate among experienced Lee Sin players is still reasonable.

He was the only jungler that was given an item to enable his abuse of hopping. If I recall ward hopping was an accident in design that Riot decided to roll with, and since Katarina lost it, I see no reason why Lee Sin should have it. Let alone an item specifically for him (unless you were pro tier Jungle) encouraging it. I'm happy with him being on Jax's level and can use it conditionally with a trinket.

No Jungle meta whilst Lee Sin was meta, was ever fun. I don't want to ever return to a point where, unless you're playing Shaco/Elise/Shyvana/Udyr, your entire jungle is ransacked and you're constantly camped. That was toxic, and junglers shouldn't ever become meta on the basis they can 1v1 a Lee Sin.

Much to the dismay of his mains, he is a champion like Olaf... That should never be allowed to be meta. He runs rampant and dictates it whenever he is.
Lee sin is  a stupid champion who deserves to be gutted in my opinion
Here we go again
lee sin is trash, those buffs won't help.
Wardhopping shouldn't even be in the game, so that's no reason why Lee should be buffed. Only if he's just underpowered (I don't know if he is, haven't looked at his stats).
